input:
Sophia is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 13), my wife (birthday on September 19), my child_1 (birthday on September 06), my father (birthday on July 27), my mother (birthday on June 05), 
2) Attending a fashion week in Paris in week 24-25.

3) Attend a parenting workshop every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Sophia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

input:
Emma is a photographer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 11), my wife (birthday on March 02), my child_1 (birthday on September 11), my father (birthday on August 19), my mother (birthday on August 30), 
2) Participating in a week-long sailing school in week 26-27.

3) Participate in a kite flying club every 3 weeks on weekends, starting from week 11.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Emma for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

input:
Olivia is a architect with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on July 04), my wife (birthday on March 28), my child_1 (birthday on December 09), my father (birthday on June 07), my mother (birthday on May 09), 
2) Exploring the ancient temples of Cambodia in week 15-16.

3) Attend a jazz music appreciation club every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 10.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Olivia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

Noah is a photographer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on March 08), my wife (birthday on July 09), my child_1 (birthday on November 06), my child_2 (birthday on August 31), my child_3 (birthday on November 17), 
2) Joining a fitness and wellness retreat in Bali in week 6-7.

3) Join a local running club for weekend marathons every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 10.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Noah for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Benjamin is a architect with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 14), my wife (birthday on January 19), my child_1 (birthday on January 01), my child_2 (birthday on March 16), my father (birthday on December 06), 
2) Joining a fitness and wellness retreat in Bali in week 32-33.

3) Attend DIY home improvement workshops every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 15.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Benjamin for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on November 30), my wife (birthday on January 25), my child_1 (birthday on February 07), my child_2 (birthday on October 02), my father (birthday on February 18),

The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

Noah is a historian with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on March 06), my wife (birthday on April 09), my child_1 (birthday on December 27), my child_2 (birthday on January 23), my father (birthday on February 13), 
2) Wildlife safari in Yellowstone National Park in week 17-18.

3) Participate in a language exchange meetup every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

Benjamin is a journalist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on September 05), my wife (birthday on October 23), my child_1 (birthday on January 08), my child_2 (birthday on April 16), my father (birthday on August 25), 
2) Exploring the castles of Scotland in week 19-20.

3) Join a weekend hiking group every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 12.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Benjamin for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
As we settle into the New Year, we offer a menu inspired by the earthy flavors of winter.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Butternut Squash Soup: Smooth and velvety butternut squash soup garnished with croutons.
1.2) Goat Cheese Stuffed Mushrooms: Mushrooms filled with tangy goat cheese and topped with a sprinkle of herbs.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Wellington: Tender filet mignon wrapped in pastry, baked to perfection and served with a rich demi-glace.
2.2) Vegetarian Moussaka: Eggplant, zucchini, and potato layered with a creamy bechamel sauce and topped with a crispy potato crust.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted until caramelized and seasoned with a touch of bacon.
3.2) Sweet Potato Mash: Smooth and slightly sweet mashed sweet potatoes.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Tart: Thin, buttery crust filled with sweet, tart apples and topped with a delicate pastry crust.
4.2) Pecan Pie: Classic Southern dessert with a buttery crust filled with gooey pecans and a sweet corn syrup caramel.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine with robust flavors to stand up to the hearty, earthy flavors of the dishes.
5.2) Spiced Cider: Warm and spiced apple cider to celebrate the winter season.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):

input:
James is a nurse with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on August 20), my wife (birthday on September 18), my child_1 (birthday on October 28), my child_2 (birthday on April 08), my father (birthday on April 05), 
2) Participating in a pottery and ceramics workshop in Japan in week 32-33.

3) Visit historic sites in the area every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 19.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for James for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Lamb Chops: Juicy lamb chops marinated in garlic, oregano, and lemon juice, grilled to perfection.
2.2) Vegan Eggplant Moussaka: A vegetarian dish featuring sliced eggplant, zucchini, and potatoes layered with a creamy tomato sauce and topped with a rich, savory bechamel sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Greek Salad: A colorful salad of cucumber, tomato, red onion, feta cheese, and olives, dressed with olive oil and red wine vinegar.
3.2) Roasted Zucchini: Tender zucchini slices roasted with garlic, olive oil, and lemon juice.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Baklava: A classic Middle Eastern dessert made from layers of phyllo dough, honey, and chopped nuts.
4.2) Turkish Delight: A sweet, gelatinous dessert flavored with rosewater and various fruits.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Ouzo: A traditional Greek anise-flavored liqueur served as an aperitif or digestif.
5.2) Sangria: A Spanish fruit cocktail made with red wine, fruit, brandy, and a splash of orange juice.
 Menu Week 7 (February 12th - February 18th):
For the seventh week, we explore dishes inspired by the vibrant flavors of India.

4. Desserts:

James is a chef with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on September 28), my wife (birthday on December 08), my child_1 (birthday on June 29), my child_2 (birthday on March 15), my child_3 (birthday on July 15), 
2) Family beach vacation in Maui in week 25-26.

3) Participate in a local startup pitch night every 4 weeks on weekends, starting from week 14.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for James for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. The shrimp are plump, succulent, and delicately sweet, perfectly complemented by the zesty, tangy cocktail sauce and the cooling cream on top. A refreshing and indulgent start to the meal.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. The meaty, earthy flavor of the mushrooms is amplified by the rich, savory cheese filling, while the garlic adds depth and complexity. These appetizers are a vegetarian delight, yet satisfying enough for anyone.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. The tender, succulent lobster meat is bathed in a velvety, golden sauce, infused with the subtle aroma of brandy and the warmth of nutmeg. A decadent and indulgent dish that is a true celebration of the sea.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. The skin is crispy and golden, while the meat is juicy and tender, with a delightful, slightly sweet and tangy orange flavor. A classic dish with an Asian twist that is sure to delight.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. The garlic adds depth and complexity, while the creamy texture of the potatoes provides a soothing, comforting backdrop for the rich flavors of the main courses.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. The glaze, made from orange juice, honey, and a hint of cinnamon, adds a delightful sweetness and a subtle, aromatic complexity to the carrots, making them a perfect accompaniment to the main courses.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. The velvety smooth texture of the mousse, combined with the deep, rich flavor of chocolate, provides a decadent and indulgent finish to the meal.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. The coffee infuses the ladyfingers with a rich, robust flavor, while the mascarpone cheese adds a velvety richness that balances the bitterness of the coffee. A perfect end to an elegant meal.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
Soup and Salad Midweek.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Bruschetta: Slices of crusty bread topped with ripe tomatoes, fresh basil, and a drizzle of olive oil. The tangy, sweet flavor of the tomatoes is beautifully balanced by the fragrant basil and the savory, toasty bread. A simple yet delicious start to the meal.
1.2) Caprese Salad: Fresh mozzarella, ripe tomatoes, and fragrant basil, dressed with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. The creamy, milky texture of the mozzarella, the tangy sweetness of the tomatoes, and the peppery aroma of the basil make for a refreshing and flavorful appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Chicken Parmesan: Breaded and fried chicken cutlets topped with marinara sauce and melted mozzarella cheese. The crispy, golden breading gives way to juicy, tender chicken, while the tangy, sweet marinara sauce and the gooey, melted mozzarella create a delightful, savory harmony.
2.2) Minestrone Soup: A hearty, vegetarian soup filled with an assortment of vegetables, beans, and pasta. The soup is rich and satisfying, with each bite bringing a new flavor and texture to the table. A perfect comfort food for a chilly winter day.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Caesar Salad: Romaine lettuce topped with croutons, parmesan cheese, and a Caesar dressing made from anchovies, garlic, and lemon juice. The crispy croutons add a delightful crunch, while the tangy, savory dressing infuses the lettuce with a rich, umami flavor.
3.2) Garlic Roasted Vegetables: A medley of seasonal vegetables roasted with garlic and olive oil. The garlic adds depth and complexity, while the roasting brings out the natural sweetness and tenderness of the vegetables. A healthy and flavorful side dish.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. The coffee infuses the ladyfingers with a rich, robust flavor, while the mascarpone cheese adds a velvety richness that balances the bitterness of the coffee. A perfect end to an elegant meal.
4.2) Apple Crumble: A warm, comforting dessert made with apples, oats, and sugar, topped with a crispy, buttery crumble. The sweet, tender apples are perfectly complemented by the nutty, crunchy texture of the crumble, making for a delicious and satisfying finish to the meal.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Assorted Beers: A selection of craft beers to complement the savory flavors of the meals.
5.2) Merlot: A bold, full-bodied red wine with a rich, fruity flavor that pairs well with the hearty, savory dishes of the week.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy, savory dip made with spinach, artichokes, and garlic, served with pita chips. The creamy texture and savory flavor make this a perfect appetizer for sharing, while the pita chips provide a satisfying crunch.
1.2) Prosciutto and Melon: Thin slices of prosciutto served with ripe melon. The salty, savory flavor of the prosciutto is beautifully complemented by the sweet, juicy flavor of the melon, making for a delicious and refreshing appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Wellington: A classic British dish consisting of a filet of beef encased in puff pastry, accompanied by a rich, savory demi-glace. The tender, juicy beef is beautifully encased in a flaky, golden pastry, while the demi-glace adds a rich, savory depth of flavor.
2.2) Grilled Portobello Mushrooms: Marinated and grilled portobello mushrooms served with a balsamic reduction. The meaty, earthy flavor of the mushrooms is amplified by the tangy, sweet balsamic reduction, making for a flavorful and vegetarian-friendly main course.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes roasted until tender and drizzled with a honey glaze. The natural sweetness of the sweet potatoes is beautifully complemented by the subtle sweetness of the honey glaze, making for a flavorful and healthier alternative to traditional potatoes.

input:
Ava is a chef with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on December 17), my wife (birthday on April 06), my child_1 (birthday on November 30), my child_2 (birthday on April 29), my child_3 (birthday on December 08), 
2) Scuba diving adventure in the Great Barrier Reef in week 16-17.

3) Attend wine tasting sessions every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 12.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Ava for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.

2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:

5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

We continue our culinary journey with an emphasis on hearty, warming dishes that celebrate the cold winter months.

2. Main Courses:

2.2) Lamb Shanks: Slow-cooked lamb shanks smothered in a rich tomato and red wine sauce, served with mashed potatoes.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Fresh Brussels sprouts roasted to caramelized perfection with garlic and balsamic vinegar.

Liam is a photographer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on November 30), my wife (birthday on September 27), my child_1 (birthday on May 07), my child_2 (birthday on May 19), my child_3 (birthday on May 11), 
2) Participating in a surfing camp in Hawaii in week 48-49.

3) Join a cycling club for group rides every 3 weeks on weekends, starting from week 17.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Liam for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. The succulent shrimp are bathed in a tangy cocktail sauce, providing a delightful balance of sweet and sour flavors. The addition of cream atop the shrimp adds an indulgent touch, making for a truly decadent starter.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. The tender mushrooms are generously stuffed with a savory and aromatic garlic herb cheese blend, which oozes out upon biting. The mushrooms are then baked until their caps are crisp and golden, creating a delightful contrast between the soft, earthy mushroom flesh and the crispy, savory cheese filling.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. The succulent lobster meat is bathed in a rich and velvety sauce made with egg yolks, brandy, and a touch of nutmeg, resulting in a luxurious and decadent dish. Served in its shell, this classic French dish delivers a truly memorable dining experience.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. The duck is roasted until its skin is crispy and golden, while the meat remains tender and juicy. The dish is finished with an irresistible orange sauce made from fresh orange zest, juice, and a hint of Grand Marnier, adding a delightful sweetness that complements the rich duck.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. The creamy and velvety mashed potatoes are infused with the subtle, sweet, and savory flavors of roasted garlic. The result is a dish that delivers a luxurious and comforting texture and taste.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. The carrots are cooked until they are tender and then finished with a sweet glaze made from a combination of brown sugar, honey, and a touch of butter. The result is a dish that delivers a delightful balance between sweetness and earthiness.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. The rich, velvety chocolate mousse is made from high-quality chocolate, egg yolks, and heavy cream. The dessert is then topped with a dollop of whipped cream and a sprinkle of chocolate shavings, adding a delightful textural contrast.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. This classic Italian dessert features layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese, resulting in a rich, indulgent, and elegant dessert. The combination of the coffee-soaked ladyfingers and the creamy, tangy mascarpone cheese creates a delightful balance between sweetness and richness.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. Our wine list includes a carefully selected range of red and white wines, each one chosen to complement the flavors of the dishes on the menu. Whether you prefer a bold and full-bodied red or a crisp and refreshing white, there is a wine to suit every palate.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. Toast to the New Year in style with a glass of champagne, perfectly paired with the rich and indulgent flavors of the menu. Whether enjoyed on its own or used to enhance the flavors of a dish, champagne adds a touch of elegance and celebration to any meal.

Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features a selection of dishes that pay homage to the rich and hearty flavors of winter.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Pumpkin Soup: A rich and creamy pumpkin soup garnished with crispy bacon. This hearty and comforting soup is made from pureed pumpkin, heavy cream, and a touch of nutmeg. The soup is then garnished with crispy bacon, adding a delightful textural contrast and a savory depth of flavor.
1.2) Caprese Bruschetta: Grilled bread topped with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil. The classic Italian appetizer gets a winter twist with the addition of roasted tomatoes and the use of Fontina Val d'Aosta cheese instead of Mozzarella. The result is a dish that delivers a delightful balance between the rich, nutty cheese, the tangy tomatoes, and the aromatic basil.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: Tender beef chunks slow-cooked in a rich red wine sauce with carrots, onions, and mushrooms. This classic French dish features tender beef chunks that have been slow-cooked in a rich red wine sauce, infused with the flavors of carrots, onions, and mushrooms. The dish is then finished with a delicate coating of thickened red wine sauce, resulting in a rich and hearty meal that is sure to warm you from the inside out.
2.2) Sweet Potato Risotto: Arborio rice cooked with sweet potatoes, Parmesan cheese, and sage. This unique take on the classic risotto dish features the use of sweet potatoes instead of traditional Arborio rice. The sweet potatoes are cooked with the rice and finished with Parmesan cheese and sage, resulting in a dish that delivers a delightful balance between the natural sweetness of the sweet potatoes and the savory, earthy flavors of the Parmesan and sage.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted with pancetta and topped with a touch of balsamic glaze. The Brussels sprouts are roasted until they are tender and caramelized, then tossed with crispy pancetta and a touch of balsamic glaze. The result is a dish that delivers a delightful balance between the bitter, earthy flavors of the Brussels sprouts and the savory, salty flavors of the pancetta and balsamic glaze.
3.2) Garlic Green Beans: Green beans sautéed with garlic and topped with toasted almonds. The green beans are sautéed with garlic until they are tender and flavorful, then finished with toasted almonds. The result is a dish that delivers a delightful crunch and a subtle, nutty flavor that complements the natural sweetness of the green beans.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar, topped with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. This comforting and indulgent dessert features layers of tender apples, a crispy oat topping, and a scoop of velvety vanilla ice cream. The result is a dish that delivers a delightful balance between the sweet, tart flavors of the apples and the savory, nutty flavors of the oats.
4.2) Dark Chocolate Pudding: A rich and velvety dark chocolate pudding, topped with a touch of whipped cream. This decadent and indulgent dessert features a rich, velvety chocolate pudding, made with high-quality dark chocolate and a touch of cream. The dessert is then topped with a dollop of whipped cream, adding a delightful textural contrast.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. Our wine list includes a carefully selected range of red and white wines, each one chosen to complement the flavors of the dishes on the menu. Whether you prefer a bold and full-bodied red or a crisp and refreshing white, there is a wine to suit every palate.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A rich and indulgent hot chocolate, topped with whipped cream and a touch of cinnamon. To keep the winter chill at bay, indulge in a warm and comforting mug of rich and indulgent hot chocolate, topped with a dollop of whipped cream and a touch of cinnamon. The perfect accompaniment to any of the dishes on the menu.

Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week's menu features a selection of dishes that showcase the bold and robust flavors of the Mediterranean.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Olive and Feta Tapenade: A rich and flavorful spread made from olives, feta cheese, and capers, served with grilled pita bread. The tapenade is made from a blend of olives, feta cheese, capers, and a touch of olive oil, resulting in a rich and savory spread that is both bold and tangy. The tapenade is then served with grilled pita bread, adding a delightful textural contrast and a subtle sweetness.
1.2) Grilled Halloumi: Halloumi cheese grilled and served with a balsamic glaze and a side of pomegranate seeds. The halloumi cheese is grilled until it is tender and slightly charred, then finished with a touch of balsamic glaze and a side of pomegranate seeds. The result is a dish that delivers a delightful balance between the savory, salty flavors of the halloumi and the sweet, tart flavors of the pomegranate seeds and balsamic glaze.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Paella: A traditional Spanish dish made with saffron-infused rice, chicken, chorizo, and shrimp. This classic Spanish dish features saffron-infused rice that is cooked with chicken, chorizo, and shrimp, resulting in a dish that is both rich and flavorful. The saffron imparts a delicate, sweet and aromatic flavor, while the chicken and chorizo add a savory depth of flavor, and the shrimp add a delightful sweetness and texture.
2.2) Lamb Shawarma: Tender lamb marinated in a blend of spices, grilled and served in a warm pita bread with pickles and tahini sauce. The lamb is marinated in a blend of spices, then grilled until it is tender and juicy. The dish is then served in a warm pita bread, along with pickles and a dollop of tangy tahini sauce. The result is a dish that delivers a delightful balance between the rich, savory flavors of the lamb and the tangy, crunchy flavors of the pickles and tahini sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Grilled Vegetables: A medley of vegetables grilled and served with a touch of herbs and olive oil. The medley of vegetables, including zucchini, bell peppers, eggplant, and squash, is grilled until they are tender and slightly charred, then finished with a touch of herbs and olive oil. The result is a dish that delivers a delightful balance between the natural sweetness of the vegetables and the savory, aromatic flavors of the herbs and olive oil.
3.2) Couscous Salad: A light and refreshing salad made with couscous, tomatoes, cucumber, and a tangy lemon vinaigrette. The couscous salad is made with couscous, tomatoes, cucumber, and a tangy lemon vinaigrette. The dish is then garnished with fresh parsley and mint, adding a delightful aromatic touch. The result is a dish that delivers a delightful balance between the light, refreshing flavors of the couscous, tomatoes, and cucumber and the tangy, zesty flavors of the lemon vinaigrette.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Baklava: A rich and decadent dessert made with layers of phyllo dough, honey, and nuts. This classic Middle Eastern dessert features layers of crispy phyllo dough, sweet honey syrup, and a generous layer of crunchy, nutty filling. The result is a dessert that delivers a delightful balance between the crispy, flaky texture of the phyllo dough and the sweet, nutty flavors of the honey and nuts.
4.2) Turkish Delight: A sweet and aromatic dessert made with rose water, pistachios, and coconut. This delightful dessert features a soft, gelatinous texture and a delicate, aromatic flavor derived from the use of rose water. The dessert is then garnished with pistachios and coconut, adding a delightful crunch and a subtle sweetness.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. Our wine list includes a carefully selected range of red and white wines, each one chosen to complement the flavors of the dishes on the menu. Whether you prefer a bold and full-bodied red or a crisp and refreshing white, there is a wine to suit every palate.
5.2) Mint Tea: A refreshing and aromatic mint tea, perfect for sipping on its own or as an accompaniment to the sweet and aromatic desserts on the menu.

Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
This week's menu features a selection of dishes that showcase the bold and spicy flavors of Asian cuisine.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Dumplings: A selection of steamed dumplings filled with pork, shrimp, or chicken, served with a soy dipping sauce. The dumplings are made from a delicate wrapper and filled with a savory meat or seafood filling, then steamed until they are tender and juicy. The result is a dish that delivers a delightful balance between the delicate, tender texture of the dumplings and the bold, savory flavors of the fillings.
1.2) Edamame: Steamed soybeans served with a touch of sea salt. The edamame are steamed until they are tender and slightly sweet, then sprinkled with a touch of sea salt. The result is a dish that delivers a delightful balance between the natural, slightly sweet flavors of the soybeans and the savory, umami flavors of the sea salt.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Pad Thai: A traditional Thai dish made with rice noodles, peanuts, bean sprouts, and a tangy tamarind sauce. This classic Thai dish features rice noodles that are stir-fried with a tangy and aromatic tamarind sauce, peanuts, bean sprouts, and scallions. The result is a dish that delivers a delightful balance between the savory, aromatic flavors of the tamarind sauce and the crunchy, nutty flavors of the peanuts.
2.2) Bulgogi: Tender beef marinated in a sweet and spicy sauce, grilled and served with a side of rice and kimchi. The bulgogi is made from tender beef that is marinated in a sweet and spicy sauce, then grilled until it is tender and juicy. The dish is then served with a side of steamed rice and kimchi, a fermented vegetable side dish that delivers a delightful balance between the spicy, savory flavors of the bulgogi and the tangy, fermented flavors of the kimchi.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Fried Rice: A classic Chinese dish made with rice, vegetables, and a savory soy sauce. The fried rice is made by stir-frying rice with a savory soy sauce and a medley of vegetables, including peas, carrots, and corn. The result is a dish that delivers a delightful balance between the savory, aromatic flavors of the soy sauce and the crunchy, slightly sweet flavors of the vegetables.
3.2) Spring Rolls: Crispy rolls filled with vegetables and a savory filling, served with a sweet and sour dipping sauce. The spring rolls are made from a crispy, golden exterior and filled with a savory filling of vegetables, including carrots, cabbage, and bok choy. The result is a dish that delivers a delightful balance between the crispy, savory flavors of the spring rolls and the sweet, tangy flavors of the dipping sauce.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Mochi: A traditional Japanese dessert made with rice cake and a sweet filling, wrapped in a soft and chewy exterior. The mochi are made by wrapping a soft and chewy exterior around a sweet, gooey filling, typically made from red bean paste or ice cream. The result is a dessert that delivers a delightful balance between the soft, chewy texture of the exterior and the sweet, gooey flavors of the filling.
4.2) Green Tea Ice Cream: A refreshing and aromatic ice cream made with green tea and a touch of sweetener. The green tea ice cream is made by infusing green tea leaves into the ice cream base and adding a touch of sweetener, resulting in a dessert that delivers a delightful balance between the refreshing, aromatic flavors of the green tea and the rich, creamy texture of the ice cream.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the bold and spicy flavors of the Asian dishes on the menu. Our wine list includes a carefully selected range of wines, each one chosen to complement the flavors of the dishes on the menu. Whether you prefer a bold and full-bodied red or a crisp and refreshing white, there is a wine to suit every palate.
5.2) Sake: A traditional Japanese alcoholic beverage made from fermented rice, perfect for sipping on its own or as an accompaniment to the bold and spicy flavors of the Asian dishes on the menu.

Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): Seafood Season Extravaganza Week!
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Fresh Seafood Platter: A stunning display of fresh seafood, including oysters, shrimp, crab, and lobster, served with a selection of sauces and accompaniments. The seafood platter is a true celebration of the freshest and most delicious offerings from the sea. The dish features a stunning display of oysters, shrimp, crab, and lobster, accompanied by a selection of sauces and accompaniments, including mignonette, cocktail sauce, and lemon wedges. The result is a dish that delivers a delightful balance between the briny, savory flavors of the seafood and the tangy, zesty flavors of the sauces and accompaniments.
1.2) Ceviche: A refreshing and zesty dish made with raw fish marinated in citrus juices and accented with herbs and spices. The ceviche is made by marinating raw fish in citrus juices, including lime and lemon, and accented with herbs and spices, such as cilantro and jalapeno. The result is a dish that delivers a delightful balance between the fresh, zesty flavors of the citrus juices and the savory, aromatic flavors of the herbs and spices.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Seafood Paella: A traditional Spanish dish made with saffron-infused rice, mussels, clams, shrimp, and calamari. The seafood paella is a true celebration of the rich, bold flavors of the sea. The dish features saffron-infused rice that is cooked with mussels, clams, shrimp, and calamari, resulting in a dish that delivers a delightful balance between the savory, aromatic flavors of the saffron and the briny, sweet flavors of the seafood.
2.2) Lobster Thermidor: A classic French dish made with succulent lobster meat baked in a rich and savory sauce, topped with breadcrumbs and a touch of parmesan cheese. The lobster thermidor is a true testament to the elegance and sophistication of French cuisine. The dish features succulent lobster meat that is baked in a rich and savory sauce, made with heavy cream, brandy, and egg yolks. The dish is then topped with breadcrumbs and a touch of parmesan cheese, resulting in a dish that delivers a delightful balance between the rich, savory flavors of the sauce and the tender, succulent flavors of the lobster meat.
3. Side Dishes:

The saffron rice is a perfect accompaniment to the bold and rich flavors of the seafood dishes on the menu. The dish is made by cooking rice in a rich, aromatic saffron-infused broth, resulting in a side dish that delivers a delightful balance between the savory, aromatic flavors of the saffron and the tender, slightly sweet flavors of the rice.
3.2) Grilled Asparagus: A crispy and savory side dish made with grilled asparagus and a touch of olive oil and lemon zest. The grilled asparagus is a perfect complement to the rich and bold flavors of the seafood dishes on the menu. The dish is made by grilling asparagus until they are tender and slightly charred, then drizzling them with olive oil and a touch of lemon zest. The result is a side dish that delivers a delightful balance between the crispy, savory flavors of the asparagus and the tangy, zesty flavors of the lemon zest.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Crème Brûlée: A classic French dessert made with a rich and creamy custard base, topped with a caramelized sugar crust. The crème brûlée is a true testament to the elegance and sophistication of French cuisine. The dish features a rich and creamy custard base that is topped with a caramelized sugar crust, resulting in a dessert that delivers a delightful balance between the smooth, velvety flavors of the custard and the crispy, caramelized flavors of the sugar crust.
4.2) Pineapple Upside-Down Cake: A classic American dessert made with a caramelized pineapple topping and a moist and tender cake base. The pineapple upside-down cake is a true celebration of the sweet, tangy flavors of pineapple. The dish features a caramelized pineapple topping that is baked atop a moist and tender cake base, resulting in a dessert that delivers a delightful balance between the sweet, tangy flavors of the pineapple and the rich, moist flavors of the cake.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A carefully curated selection of wines, including whites, reds, and rosés, to complement the rich and bold flavors of the seafood dishes on the menu. Our wine list features a carefully curated selection of wines, including whites, reds, and rosés, that have been chosen to complement the rich and bold flavors of the seafood dishes on the menu. Whether you prefer a crisp and refreshing white wine or a bold and full-bodied red wine, there is a wine to suit every palate.
5.2) Sangria: A refreshing and fruity cocktail made with red wine, fruit, and a touch of brandy and orange liqueur. The sangria is a perfect accompaniment to the bold and rich flavors of the seafood dishes on the menu. The result is a refreshing and fruity cocktail that delivers a delightful balance between the bold, fruity flavors of the fruit and the rich, savory flavors of the wine.

Menu Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th)

3.2) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy and smooth mashed potatoes infused with garlic and butter, topped with a touch of chives and a dollop of sour cream. 4.2) Apple Tart: A sweet and tart dessert made with apples baked in a buttery and flaky pastry crust, served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. The robust and smoky flavors of the bourbon are perfectly balanced by the sweet and aromatic flavors of the orange peel and cherry, making for a delightful and sophisticated drinking experience.

Menu Week 7 (February 12th - February 18th)
1. Appetizers:

The juicy and flavorful tomatoes are perfectly complemented by the fragrant and aromatic basil, while the creamy and mild mozzarella adds a delightful touch of richness and tanginess, all brought together by the slightly sweet and tangy balsamic glaze.

Menu Week 8 (February 19th - February 25th)
1. Appetizers:

The rich and aromatic flavors of the saffron-infused rice are perfectly complemented by the tender and juicy flavors of the chicken, shrimp, and mussels, while the bell peppers and peas add a delightful touch of sweetness and texture.
2.2) Beef Stroganoff: A hearty and flavorful dish made with tender strips of beef, sour cream, mushrooms, onions, and egg noodles. The rich and savory flavors of the beef are perfectly

Noah is a journalist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on January 19), my wife (birthday on March 22), my child_1 (birthday on May 03), my child_2 (birthday on January 09), my child_3 (birthday on January 29), 
2) Participating in a martial arts training camp in China in week 11-12.

3) Attend fitness bootcamps in the park every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 15.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Noah for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
Cherry Blossom Festival Dishes.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Cherry Blossom Tea: A delicate blend of green tea, cherry blossoms, and subtle sweeteners, served hot or cold.
1.2) Sushi Roll with Cherry Blossom: A fresh sushi roll filled with crab, cucumber, and avocado, topped with pickled cherry blossoms.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Cherry Blossom Chicken: Tender chicken breasts marinated in a cherry blossom sauce, grilled to perfection, and served with rice.
2.2) Vegetarian Cherry Blossom Bowl: A hearty vegetarian bowl filled with assorted vegetables, tofu, and a cherry blossom broth.
3. Side Dishes:

3.2) Cherry Blossom Rice: Fragrant jasmine rice infused with cherry blossom water.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Cherry Blossom Macarons: Colorful and delicate macarons filled with a light cherry blossom flavored ganache.
4.2) Cherry Blossom Cake: A stunning cherry blossom-themed cake made with layers of delicate vanilla sponge cake and cherry blossom-infused buttercream.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Sake: A fine selection of Japanese sake, complementing the cherry blossom flavors in the dishes.
5.2) Cherry Blossom cocktail: A refreshing cocktail made with cherry blossom tea, sake, and a splash of sweet lychee juice.

Continuing our culinary journey, we present a savory collection of offerings for the third week.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Prosciutto Wrapped Melon: Sweet cantaloupe wrapped in paper-thin slices of prosciutto, drizzled with balsamic glaze.
1.2) Grilled Artichoke Hearts: Char-grilled artichoke hearts served with a tangy dipping sauce.
2. Main Courses:

3. Side Dishes:

3.2) Garlic Knots: Soft and chewy garlic knots, perfect for soaking up savory sauces.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Truffles: Velvety smooth chocolate truffles coated in cocoa powder.
4.2) Crème Brûlée: A classic French dessert with a rich custard base and a caramelized sugar crust.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wines: A selection of bold, full-bodied red wines to complement the robust flavors of the meals.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
Our fourth week menu features a delectable assortment of dishes inspired by the exotic flavors of the Far East.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Edamame: Young soybeans steamed and seasoned with sea salt.
1.2) Dumplings: Soft, savory dumplings filled with flavorful meat or vegetables, served with a soy dipping sauce.

William is a economist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 26), my wife (birthday on August 02), my child_1 (birthday on April 27), my child_2 (birthday on August 17), my father (birthday on January 03), 
2) Joining a culinary tour focused on Mexican cuisine in week 44-45.

3) Attend fitness bootcamps in the park every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 14.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for William for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. This classic seafood appetizer is always a crowd-pleaser, with its sweet and tangy sauce perfectly complementing the succulent shrimp.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. These flavorful bites offer an irresistible combination of earthy mushrooms and savory herbs, bound together by melted cheese for a delightful start to the meal.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. This exquisite dish boasts the rich, buttery flavor of succulent lobster meat, elevated by the creamy sauce and baked to golden perfection.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. The perfectly cooked duck, with its crisp skin and juicy meat, is transformed by the tangy, sweet orange glaze, creating a harmonious blend of flavors.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. Our comforting and delectable side dish is made from velvety mashed potatoes infused with the subtle, sultry sweetness of roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. The tender carrots, bathed in a sweet and sticky glaze, add a touch of natural sweetness and textural contrast to the meal.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. Our velvety, decadent chocolate mousse is a true indulgence, with its creamy texture and intense chocolate flavor elevated by a crown of fluffy whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. This beloved Italian dessert is a feast for the senses, with its rich, coffee-infused ladyfingers layered between creamy mascarpone and finished with a dusting of cocoa powder.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. Our carefully chosen selection of wines offers the perfect pairing for each dish, enhancing your dining experience.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. Start the New Year with a glass of bubbly champagne, toasting to new opportunities and the joys of fine dining.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
Celebrating Veganuary with a special plant-based dish.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Grilled Vegetable Skewers: Marinated vegetables grilled to perfection on skewers. This vibrant and flavorful starter features seasonal vegetables that are marinated to perfection and grilled for a delightful char.
1.2) Falafel: Crispy, golden chickpea balls served with a tangy tahini sauce. Our traditional Middle Eastern falafel offers a delightful textural contrast and rich, earthy flavor, enhanced by a tangy and creamy tahini sauce.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Vegan Lentil Shepherd's Pie: A hearty lentil and vegetable pie topped with creamy mashed potatoes. This comforting and flavorful dish boasts a rich, savory lentil and vegetable filling topped with a fluffy layer of creamy mashed potatoes.
2.2) Grilled Portobello Mushroom: Marinated and grilled Portobello mushrooms served with a balsamic glaze. This succulent, meaty mushroom is marinated to bring out its earthy, robust flavor, and grilled until tender and caramelized, served with a sweet, tangy balsamic glaze.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted to perfection. Our roasted root vegetables offer a delicious, textured accompaniment to the main course, bursting with natural sweetness and earthy flavors.
3.2) Quinoa Salad: A refreshing salad made from fluffy quinoa, vegetables, and a tangy dressing. This colorful and satisfying salad features tender quinoa mixed with an assortment of vegetables and a zesty, tangy dressing, making for a delightful pairing to the main course.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Vegan Chocolate Cake: A rich, moist vegan chocolate cake topped with a silky chocolate ganache. This decadent and indulgent dessert boasts a rich, moist chocolate cake that is topped with a velvety, smooth chocolate ganache, a true treat for those who choose a plant-based diet.
